extendedInfo.description: Collect, organize, and access your information anytime, anywhere with HanDBase!  A full featured relational database manager, HanDBase gives you the power to create custom solutions that can replace the need for countless third party apps:* Inventory* Time and Billing for consulting* Patient Lists, Billing Codes* Deliveries* Shopping and Packing Lists* CRM/Contact Management* To Do Lists/Task/Project Management* Sales Numbers* Recipes, Weight Loss, Auto Mileage* DVD and hobby Collections* and so much more!We offer an online Gallery of predesigned database templates, with thousands of databases to choose from:http://www.ddhsoftware.com/gallery.htmlWith your data stored locally, HanDBase lets you design the databases to meet your specifications.  When designing your database, choose from field types including:* Text and notes* Integer* Float* Date* Time* Popups* Relationship* Calculations and Conditionals* Signature* and more!Need even more functionality?  HanDBase provides support for:* 128 Bit Encryption of selected fields/databases* Filter data based on a wide range of parameters* Quick search directly from the list of records, or run an advanced search* Create custom views - named sets of filters and field settings for easy recall* Import and export CSV files* Run Reports across records with graphs and charts* Email and synchronize databases between devices* WiFi Server mode for downloading/uploading/importing/exporting your databases from/to your desktop browserWant to work with your HanDBase database on your Windows or Mac computer?* Download a FREE 30 day trial version of one of our optional add-ons, which allow you to create, view and edit your databases on the computer.* Want to synchronize data between HanDBase on your phone and on your computer?  We've got a solution for that.  Want to synchronize data between a third party database like Microsoft Access or Filemaker?  We've got a solution for that as well.* Get started with a trial version here:  http://ddhsoftware.com/handbaseandroidwin.htmlSUPPORT* Check out HanDBase's manual at http://www.ddhsoftware.com/docs/HanDBaseforAndroidUserGuide.pdf* Visit our forum at http://www.ddhsoftware.com/forum * Contact us via email at http://www.ddhsoftware.com/support.htmlGOOGLE PLAY COMMENTSWhen leaving a review for HanDBase in Google Play, please consider that we cannot respond to bug reports or feature requests posted here.  If you have a feature request or encounter a bug, please use one of the channels noted below.  We also ask that you please consider that positive reviews grow the success of HanDBase in many ways, while bug reports or complaints posted as reviews only serve to slow the growth and ability to fix these problems, by confusing users on the usefulness of the program.KNOWN LIMITATIONSHanDBase for Android supports the ASCII character set only, at this time.  Unicode characters are NOT supported.  Custom data entry forms are not supported at this time.  Instead, as illustrated in the screenshots, HanDBase for Android displays a dynamically drawn data entry form that is based on field definitions.

reviews.title: Keeps getting better
reviews.comment: I have not found the features i dream of. I am a long time user back to the palm os version. It has come a long way and I have come to expect those features in newer products, no support photos and gps location. However the email technical support is very responsive.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: HandBase Database
reviews.comment: Great App, I wish the developer add the option to be able to edit row height and, also adding call feature.  Keep up the good work, the app is very nice and running very smooth.
reviews.author: Habib R

reviews.title: Needs improvement
reviews.comment: Long time user. Key improvements have been made, like being able to backup a database file to Dropbox (or your choice). One area needing improvement is the ability to make forms on the phone/tablet. This seems obvious for usability. It appears to be a one of a kind database app, so I\'ll keep using it. But would switch if one came along with forms capability.
reviews.author: Steven Sauder

reviews.title: Works Well. No Longer Supported?
reviews.comment: Old Palm & Symbian user. This app works well on my Nexus 4. Website / Releases not updated for awhile now.  Wonder if we\'ll ever get Forms for Android version? Good bang for Buck value. Recommended.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Unneccessary.
reviews.comment: Worse even old windows mobile versions. There is no updates or improvements. Naturally worse than ios version too. Lack of user interface, it\'s not userfriendly, almost userenemy. Waste of money.
reviews.author: Ahmet Yildirim

reviews.title: Are You Glad for HanDBase?
reviews.comment: Still Android\'s only stable fully graphical relational database so indispensible. The basics are here (must check their docs templates) & devs very responsive. But awaiting features: multimedia data types, intent integration, regexes, industry-standard format backup/restore. Cf Memento, NoteLynx (non-relational), My Data, abcDB (relational). Server feature helps but extra premium-price desktop integration is way out of line: we build enterprise SQL dbs for free these days!
reviews.author: Derek Thomas

reviews.title: Excellent effort by developer
reviews.comment: Have been using this software for 3 months and I find it quite powerful once you get to know it. The developer is extremely helpful and even helped me with a problem I had where I couldn\'t figure out how to make a linked table. With this said I am convinced that he is working hard in solving all problems and requests and definitely deserves 5* rating
reviews.author: chris moulettaris

reviews.title: Some good features, some misleading ads
reviews.comment: I was initially quite excited by this app --- it promotes itself as having some good features, and the photos on the apps Play page make it look really clever, compared to other apps BUT those photos will NEVER be obtained using the current version Android app, they come from apps for other platforms (in this case, at least, the desktop addon)!!! And some of the best features are dependent on purchasing expensive addons. It certainly has \"potential\" but I think its full advertised price, and its adds, need to include reference to those more expensive addons. The current promotion can\'t truly be considered as other than a scam. These \"deficiencies\" explain the current low rating of the app, but not the obscenely high ratings for its competitor -- we simply don\'t have an \"adequate\" Android database app. And after sales support? Fuggedaboutit!  My non-receipt of \"service\", related to inability to access Play Market sales records, shows they shouldn\'t be selling through here.
reviews.author: Russell Wilson

reviews.title: Reliable and friendly
reviews.comment: I have been using HanDBase since the heyday of the Palm, through S60, IOS and now Android. The app has proved reliable and adaptable and I cannot imagine not having it available. I also use the desktop add-on  Setting up databases and altering their fields and parameters is straight-forward and intuitive and the user is able to import and export data to/from external files.  Other versions of the database did have a \'forms\' ability, which I used on my Palm. Amazingly easy to spend hours tweaking something that works fine :-) When the IOS app first came out, this facility was not available but I got used to not having it quite quickly. The easy screen scrolling of the iPhone to some extent mitigated against this absence, and the same applies to Android. I guess if forms became available I would use them, but the app is perfectly usable without.  Support is very prompt and helpful. On the odd occasion when I have asked for advice, this has taken a day to appear, but given the difference in our time-zones, I regard this as excellent service.  All in all, an excellent database application.
reviews.author: Colin Shaper

reviews.title: Good basic database with new definition of a \"form\"
reviews.comment: Capable database with a lot of good features. The \"form\" is more like a filtered table view - which is very useful as it allows you to sort by date, putting recent entries on the screen.  What I was hoping for was \"forms\" in the sense that Ms Access has them, as a customisable data entry screen. Every field will take up a whole line - for a small screen this is not a good use of the space. Date and time and some other data could easily fit on one line and you typically don\'t need the labels.  Overall: good
reviews.author: Martin Hunter

reviews.title: Slick, but limited
reviews.comment: This app looks good but lacks the functionality of the Smartlist To Go app that I had on my palm previously. There is just no way that I can duplicate those databases on this android app. Most importantly, it lacks the ability to write functions.
reviews.author: Gerry Vanbrabant

reviews.title: Lazy
reviews.comment: It seems like the developers are merely going through the motions with this app none of the external apps work no dialers no photo not even a barcode I used this app first on ios and was very happy to see it in play store, but seems like they are only concerned with I-crap no interest for us
reviews.author: rj escalera

reviews.title: Best database out there
reviews.comment: Great app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A shadow
reviews.comment: Of its former glory with palm come on guys get with the modern age
reviews.author: Tony Cooper

reviews.title: Link to Photos?
reviews.comment: When are we going to have the ability to link photos in the Android version of this app?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Waiting for forms support
reviews.comment: Scheduled for July?  Will there be configurable query reports?  Otherwise enjoying the functionality....   would love to have a stylesheet function, use this as backend to html form input...   overall good - could be amazing.
reviews.author: Nigel Stewart

reviews.title: The best on Android
reviews.comment: Having tested other database managers thoroughly I declare this one to be the best.
reviews.author: Michael Habermann

reviews.title: Just the ticket
reviews.comment: I have been looking for a replacement for abcDb that I used to use on Windows CE devices. This is not quite so comprehensive but far simpler and very effective for mobile data capture. Needs barcode capture to make this 5 star for me.
reviews.author: Jonathan Hoskyns

reviews.title: Functions well, waiting for upgrades
reviews.comment: Just bought this recently, it functions well for now, but I\'m waiting for features (from other platform) to hit android as well, especially forms and photos. Hopefully it will be soon. Until then switching back and forth between this and memento depending on whether I need photos or not
reviews.author: Richard Thng

reviews.title: Cross-platform db
reviews.comment: HanDBase can handle any of your list you need to keep easily but also has some more advanced features like calculated fields and table relationships for your more complicated needs. One of the best features is its ability to share the same database across platforms - I use it with my PC, Android tablet, Android phone, and an iPad.
reviews.author: Michael Presley
